Posts.Content: Hey everyone. I was diagnosed a month ago with HER+ ER- Grade 1/2 BC.  I have completed round 1 of my chemo and I’m now really struggling again with anxiety. Im finding myself comparing my story to others and reading and fearing the absolute worst. I’m terrified that at 30.... this is it for me.  Where are the positive stories and do people really get through this successfully because at the moment I just can’t see it :-( X
Posts.Title: Scared and it’s only just beginning

Posts.Content: Thank you so much everyone. Whilst I’m sorry we are in/have been in the same boat... I’m just pleased to see that there is light at the end of the tunnel after all. I just wish it was talked about a bit more - the media is all doom and gloom  xx
Posts.Title: Scared and it’s only just beginning

Posts.Content: Hi ladies - I feel I’m a bit isolated in my diagnosis as I can’t find many other people with ER Neg BC!  I’m stage 2 - predominantly due to size (5cm) but no known spread to lymph nodes. I’m undergoing pretty gruelling TCHP chemo before any surgery in a bid to reduce the size.  Is there anyone else out there who has some positive stories about this type of BC? I know everyone is different but I’m 30 and so scared of spread/ recurrence and keep reading that ER- has more chance of coming back and spreading!!  Any support would be great!! X
Posts.Title: Any ER Negative / HER2 Postive Ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Thank you for the quick replies ladies! I really felt I was in the minority and all I kept reading (googling) was that ER neg was not good and doubled up with HER2 was even worse!!  I have since been told by my oncologist that they actually prefer to you to be her positive now that Herceptin is on the cards! So I felt a bit better about that!! Xx
Posts.Title: Any ER Negative / HER2 Postive Ladies out there?
